primary_contest.tagline: How good are your coding skills?

track.name: Algorithms
track.descriptions: The true test of problem solving: when one realizes that time and memory aren't infinite.

primary_contest.description:
How good are your coding skills? 
Join thousands of coders from around the world to solve algorithmic coding challenges and see how you measure up against some of the best programmers on the planet. Top performers will be introduced to sponsoring companies looking to hire. You’ll have 48 hours to solve 8 challenges and win prizes. See you on the leaderboard!
primary_contest.name: World CodeSprint 8

model.name: Roads and Libraries
model.php_template:
<?php

$handle = fopen ("php://stdin", "r");
fscanf($handle, "%i",$q);
for($a0 = 0; $a0 < $q; $a0++){
    fscanf($handle, "%i %i %li %li", $n, $m, $x, $y);
    for($a1 = 0; $a1 < $m; $a1++){
        fscanf($handle, "%i %i", $city_1, $city_2);
    }
}

?>
model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

q = gets.strip.to_i
for a0 in (0..q-1)
    n, m, x, y = gets.strip.split(' ')
    n = n.to_i
    m = m.to_i
    x = x.to_i
    y = y.to_i
    for a1 in (0..m-1)
        city_1, city_2 = gets.strip.split(' ')
        city_1 = city_1.to_i
        city_2 = city_2.to_i
    end
end
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    q_temp <- getLine
    let q = read q_temp :: Int
    forM_ [1..q] $ \a0  -> do
        n_temp <- getLine
        let n_t = words n_temp
        let n = read $ n_t!!0 :: Int
        let m = read $ n_t!!1 :: Int
        let x = read $ n_t!!2 :: Int
        let y = read $ n_t!!3 :: Int
        forM_ [1..m] $ \a1  -> do
            city_1_temp <- getLine
            let city_1_t = words city_1_temp
            let city_1 = read $ city_1_t!!0 :: Int
            let city_2 = read $ city_1_t!!1 :: Int

getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Help the ruler of HackerLand determine the cheapest way to give his citizens access to libraries.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
        let [
          q_t (read-line) 
          q (Integer/parseInt q_t) 
        ]

      (
        loop [a0 q]
        (when (> a0 0)

          (
            let [
              n_temp (read-line) 
              n_t (split n_temp #"\s+") 
              n (Integer/parseInt (n_t 0)) 
              m (Integer/parseInt (n_t 1)) 
              x (Integer/parseInt (n_t 2)) 
              y (Integer/parseInt (n_t 3)) 
            ]
          )

          (
            loop [a1 m]
            (when (> a1 0)

              (
                let [
                  city_1_temp (read-line) 
                  city_1_t (split city_1_temp #"\s+") 
                  city_1 (Integer/parseInt (city_1_t 0)) 
                  city_2 (Integer/parseInt (city_1_t 1)) 
                ]
              )

            (recur (- a1 1) ) )
          )

        (recur (- a0 1) ) )
      )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [Q]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
    Q_list = lists:seq(1,Q),
    lists:foreach( fun(Q0) ->
            { ok, [N,M,X,Y]} = io:fread("", "~d~d~d~d"),
            M_list = lists:seq(1,M),
            lists:foreach( fun(M1) ->
                    { ok, [City_1,City_2]} = io:fread("", "~d~d")
            end,M_list)
    end,Q_list),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
q = io.read("*number", "*l")
a0 = 0
while a0 < q do
    n,m,x,y = io.read("*number", "*number", "*number", "*l")
    a1 = 0
    while a1 < m do
        city_1,city_2 = io.read("*number", "*number", "*l")
        a1 = a1 + 1
    end
    a0 = a0 + 1
end
